page.title: 13FARMING:HIGH FARM,RUSHDEN
page.content: By Debra Craig, aged 10. Mr Old told us that he had owned his farm since 1934. He owns 210 acres. 54 acres are used for grazing, the rest for growing wheat and barley.We asked him Â£How much, would you pay per acre, if you were to buy that land today?' He said it would cost {2 000 pounds per acre.}He uses nitrogen fertilizer He sometimes gets pests on the crops so he sprays the crops.He uses special food for his animals.He keeps cows, sheep and chickens.{A normal wage for a farm worker would be about 120 pounds a week.} Mr Old keeps lots of farm machinery. They cost thousands of pounds.When the machinery breaks down he sometimes fixes the machines, but usually he gets the agricultural engineer in.
